24:I[78891,["529","static/chunks/529-b3a318fab494e03f.js","244","static/chunks/244-f8e89f92ed6eb924.js","839","static/chunks/839-b514104c7e948606.js","165","static/chunks/165-ae3b45f0d86ef78d.js","184","static/chunks/app/dashboard/roots/%5Broot%5D/page-e0a9e2c37c8cb20d.js"],"CardTitle"]
25:T4dc,You who believe, when you contract a debt for a stated term, put it down in writing: have a scribe write it down justly between you. No scribe should refuse to write: let him write as God has taught him, let the debtor dictate, and let him fear God, his Lord, and not diminish &#91;the debt&#93; at all. If the debtor is feeble-minded, weak, or unable to dictate, then let his guardian dictate justly. Call in two men as witnesses. If two men are not there, then call one man and two women out of those you approve as witnesses, so that if one of the two women should forget the other can remind her. Let the witnesses not refuse when they are summoned. Do not disdain to write the debt down, be it small or large, along with the time it falls due: this way is more equitable in God&rsquo;s eyes, more reliable as testimony, and more likely to prevent doubts arising between you. But if the merchandise is there and you hand it over, there is no blame on you if you do not write it down. Have witnesses present whenever you trade with one another, and let no harm be done to either scribe or witness, for if you did cause them harm, it would be a crime on your part. Be mindful of God, and He will teach you: He has full knowledge of everything26:T250f,<entryFree id="n42885" key="قَامَ" type="main">

                     <itype>1</itype>

                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He stood still</hi> (Ksh and Bd in ii. 19) <hi rend="ital">in his place.</hi> (Ksh.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَتِ الدَّابَّةُ</foreign>

                  <hi rend="ital">He,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it, stood up,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">erect;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">اِنْتَصَبَ</foreign>. (K.) And hence, <hi rend="ital">He rose,</hi> i. e. from sitting or reclining.          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ بِاللَّيْلِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He rose in the night</hi> to pray.          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ</foreign>

                  <hi rend="ital">The people rose to prayer:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the time of their doing so came.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="7">-b7-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَتِ السَّاعَةُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The resurrection,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the time thereof, came to pass.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="8">-b8-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَتِ الشَّمْسُ وَكَادَ الظِّلُّ يَعْقِلُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The sun became high, and the shade almost disappeared, at midday</hi>]. (JK.)          <sense type="b" n="9">-b9-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ عَلَيْهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He rose up against him:</hi> see a verse cited voce <foreign lang="ar">حُوبٌ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="10">-b10-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ بِالأَمْرِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He undertook the affair; took,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imposed, it upon himself;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">تَكَفَّلَ بِهِ</foreign>; and the epithet is <foreign lang="ar">قَائِمٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">قَيِّمٌ</foreign>: (Ham, p. 5:) [and] <hi rend="ital">he managed, conducted, ordered, regulated,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">superintended, the affair;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">سَاسَهُ</foreign>; (TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">سوس</foreign>;) and <foreign lang="ar">قام عَلَيْهِ</foreign> has this latter signification; and <hi rend="ital">he tended,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">took care of, it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">him;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">سَاسَهُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">وَلِيَهُ</foreign>: (Ham ubi supra:) [and] the former signifies <hi rend="ital">he attended to the affair;</hi> [<hi rend="ital">occupied himself with it</hi>]; (this should be the first explanation;) <hi rend="ital">was mindful of it; kept to it constantly,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steadily;</hi> and is <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">قَعَدَ عَنْهُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">تَقَاعَدَ</foreign>: (JM, q. v.:) [or,] as <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">قعد</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">عنه</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">تقاعد</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">he acted vigorously in the affair;</hi> as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n42885-1" target="أَقَامَهُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>; syn. <foreign lang="ar">جَدَّ فِيهِ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">تَجَلَّدَ</foreign>.                   <hi rend="ital">He undertook,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">superintended,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">managed, his affair,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affairs.</hi> And you say, <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ بِاليَتِيمِ</foreign>, (Msb in art. <foreign lang="ar">عول</foreign>,) and <foreign lang="ar">بِالصَّبِىِّ</foreign>, (Idem, art. <foreign lang="ar">كفل</foreign>,) <hi rend="ital">He maintained the orphan,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">the child;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">عَالَهُ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">كَفَلَهُ</foreign>: (Idem:) and <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ المَرْأَةَ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">عَلَيْهَا</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">He undertook the maintenance of the woman;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">he maintained her;</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">مَانَهَا</foreign> [i. e. <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ بِكِفَايَتِهَا</foreign> (S and K in art. <foreign lang="ar">مون</foreign>)];) <hi rend="ital">and undertook,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">managed, her affair,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affairs.</hi> (K.) And <foreign lang="ar">الرِّجَالُ يَقُومُونَ عَلَى النِّسَآءِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The men govern the women:</hi> (Bd, iv. 38:) or <hi rend="ital">are mindful of them, and act well to them,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take care of them.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="12">-b12-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قامَ بِعُذْرِى</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He undertook,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">it served, to excuse me</hi>].                   <hi rend="ital">He,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it, was supported,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sustained, by it; subsisted by it:</hi> see the explanation of <foreign lang="ar">قَِوَامٌ</foreign> in the Msb.          <sense type="b" n="14">-b14-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ عَلَيْهِ كَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">It cost him such a thing, such a sum,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">so much.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="15">-b15-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ</foreign> often signifies <foreign lang="ar">ثَبَتَ</foreign>: so in <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ فِى نَفْسِهِ</foreign>

                  <hi rend="ital">It was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, established in his mind that it was so.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="16">-b16-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ بِهِ قِيَامًا تَامًّا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He managed it perfectly.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="17">-b17-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">قَامَ يَفْعَلُ كَذَا</foreign>
